meanings.definition: Unwilling to work or use energy
meanings.sent1: The cat was too lazy to chase the mouse.
meanings.sent2: She always takes the lazy route and avoids any hard work.
meanings.sent3: The lazy squirrel preferred napping to gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: The lazy river meandered slowly through the valley.
meanings.sent5: His lazy attitude made him miss out on opportunities.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of effort or care
meanings.sent1: He gave a lazy attempt at solving the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The student's lazy handwriting made it hard to read.
meanings.sent3: The lazy gardener forgot to water the plants for days.
meanings.sent4: The lazy clouds drifted aimlessly across the sky.
meanings.sent5: Her lazy excuse for being late didn't convince anyone.

meanings.sent1: The lazy turtle inched its way across the road.
meanings.sent2: The old car made a lazy turn around the corner.
meanings.sent3: The lazy snail finally reached the top of the wall.
meanings.sent4: The lazy smoke rose lazily from the chimney.
meanings.sent5: The lazy afternoon sun cast long shadows on the ground.
